abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed project would have three
            major objectives: (a) to continue assistance under earlier
            Bank financed projects for livestock and dairy development;
            (b) to promote agricultural diversification by supporting
            cultivation of crops in association with livestock; and (c)
            to assist settlers in National Settlement Institute colonies
            to improve techniques and production patterns on their
            farms, which are currently suffering from soil erosion and
            depletion. The objectives would be achieved through a three
            year commitment, five year investment program of US$100
            million equivalent, assisted by extension and technical
            services costing about US$11.0 million. Sixty percent of the
            investment program would be financed by the Bank of the
            Republic; the Bank and the farmers would finance the
            remainder. The project faces no unusual risks. There is,
            however, an element of uncertainty as regards producers
            demand for investment loans.
